text: Robotnik (The Worker) was the name of an underground newspaper (bibuła) published by the democratic socialist wing of the Solidarity resistance movement in the People's Republic of Poland during the period of martial law in Poland, between the years 1983 and 1990. It was named after the Polish Socialist Party pre-war periodical of the same name. ==See also== *Tygodnik Solidarność ==References== Category:1983 establishments in Poland Category:1990 disestablishments in Poland Category:Defunct newspapers published in Poland Category:Polish Socialist Party Category:Polish-language newspapers Category:Publications established in 1983 Category:Publications disestablished in 1990 Category:Solidarity (Polish trade union) Category:Socialist newspapers
title: Robotnik (1983–1990)
